title: Mark Ronson Pairs With Pulse Music Group for New PublishingÂ Venture
summary: Swedish producer Becky and the Birds is the joint venture's first signing.
body: Pulse Music Group has forged a new music publishing joint venture with Grammy Award-winning producer-songwriter Mark Ronson and his company Zelig Music, it was announced Tuesday (Oct. 7). The ventureâ€™s first signing is Swedish artist Thea Gustafsson , who writes, records and produces under her stage name Becky and the Birds and earlier this year won producer of the year at the Grammis awards for her album Only Music Makes Me Cry Now . Ronson â€” a nine -time Grammy winner who’s also earned an Oscar and a Golden Globe â€” is best known for producing Amy Winehouseâ€™s landmark Back to Black album, crafting his Bruno Mars-sung solo single “Uptown Funk,” and co-writing “Shallow” from A Star Is Born . In 2023, he executive produced Barbie The Album and its score, and this yâ€¦

title: Ed Sheeran Teaming Up With â€˜Adolescenceâ€™ Director For â€˜One Shotâ€™ Netflix Special To Be Shot Live in NewÂ York
summary: The single-take special is slated to air on Nov. 21.
body: Ed Sheeran is taking a runner on his next project. The singer revealed in an Instagram post on Monday night (Oct. 6) that he has teamed up with Netflix to create a “groundbreaking, one-shot music experience” to be directed by Emmy-winning Adolescence director Philip Barantini. Related Taylor Swift Dishes On Which Musician Friend She’s Sure Will Want to Perform at Her Wedding: ‘It Would Be Hard to Keep Him From It’ Rise Festival 2025 Rises Above Night 1 Weather Issues for an Elevated Desert Weekend With RÃ¼fÃ¼s du Sol, Calvin Harris & John Mayer BLACKPINK's JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: 'Two Voices, One Orbit' The special, One Shot With Ed Sheeran , will premiere on Nov. 21 and will all be captured in a single, continuous take, a technically challenging format that Barantini has made his calling card in the four-episode British crime drama Adolescence , as well as his 2021 film Boiling Point . According to a description, the special will follow Sheeran “on an unforgettable journey through the streets of New York City as he delights pedestrians with impromptu performances of his greatest hits” on sidewalksâ€¦

summary: Stable One UI 8 update is now available for carrier-locked versions in the US.
body: Credit: Lanh Nguyen / Android Authority TL;DR Android 16-based One UI 8 update is now available for the Galaxy Z Fold 5 and Galaxy Z Flip 5 in the US. The new software is rolling out for carrier-locked versions with firmware F946USQU6FYI8 and F731USQU6FYI8, respectively. One UI 8 brings a new 90:10 split-screen ratio, a refined DeX experience, and other features. Samsungâ€™s Android 16-based One UI 8 update rollout is in full swing. Many of its older flagships have begun receiving the update, including the Galaxy Z Fold 5 and Galaxy Z Flip 5. Now, the update is expanding to the Fold 5 and Flip 5 in the US, finally giving users a taste of stable One UI 8 and all the goodies that Android 16 brings along. body: Building a â€œsmartâ€ home can mean different things for different people. You can start small with a smart speaker and a few smart bulbs, a robot vacuum, and some essential security cameras. Or go all out with â€œsmartâ€ everything from your doorbell, door locks, lights, and plugs, to your fridge, washing machine, dryer, and even your lawn mower. The possibilities are endless, and so is the amount of money you might end up spending to get the proper setup. If youâ€™re smart about your smart home, finding deals throughout the year is a great way to reduce the strain on your wallet. And of course, Amazonâ€™s Prime Day often has the best deals around. These are some of the best smart home tools you can buy this Prime Day.

title: Googleâ€™s Duolingo competitor is surprisingly good
summary: AI-powered language learning might just be my new favorite AI use case.
body: Credit: Mitja Rutnik / Android Authority My current Duolingo streak is 631 days and counting, and that doesnâ€™t take into account the 223-day streak I had before missing a day (yes, I was sad about that). So when Google recently rolled out beta access to a new feature in its popular Google Translate app â€” a prominently-placed Practice mode â€” I knew I needed to try it out right away. Practice mode not only has a heavy emphasis on speaking, which I find helps me a lot more than multiple choice or fill-in-the-blank methods, but you can also create new lessons entirely on the fly, thanks to a heavy dose of AI powering this feature. Iâ€™m honestly surprised by how polished Practice mode is already, and Iâ€™d imagine the small qualms I have will be remedied as it moves out of beta. And the best part is that itâ€™s completely free.

title: Another Nintendo Switch emulator just added Silksong support, plus a â€˜Turboâ€™ mode
summary: Yet another way to enjoy the long-awaited sequel.
body: Credit: Curtis Joe / Android Authority TL;DR Ryujinx fork Kenji-NX just released its first major update in more than four months. The Nintendo Switch emulator now offers compatibility with Silksong and more. The update is now available on Windows, macOS, and Linux, with Android to follow soon. Nintendo Switch emulation has experienced a significant revival this year, with Yuzu forks like Citron and Eden continuing where the Yuzu team left off after the project was shut down by Nintendo last year. The other major Switch emulator targeted by Nintendo, Ryujinx, has also seen continued development as Kenji-NX, and a new update just brought it even closer to its competitors. Release 2.0.5 dropped yesterday, with a variety of performance and compatibility enhancements. One of the biggest features is a new Turbo Mode. This adds a hotkey to speed up CPU cycles, which may function like a fast-forward button on similar emulators.

title: Everybody loves Nano Banana, and now itâ€™s getting ready for Google Lens and Circle to Search
summary: Google may soon bring Nano Banana image editing to more than just Search AI Mode.
body: TL;DR Google is currently looking to expand access to its Nano Banana editor by integrating it across apps and services. Weâ€™ve uncovered evidence of Nano Banana preparations in Google Lens and Circle to Search. The Lens integration appears slightly further along, and mirrors what weâ€™ve already seen from Search AI Mode. Nano Banana might be the best thing to happen to Googleâ€™s AI offerings in a while, and over the last few weeks weâ€™ve had a lot of fun checking out what the system can do â€” even if it does seem to struggle a little with varying aspect ratios . Weâ€™ve already seen hints that Google has big plans for the tool, like integrating Nano Banana with Search AI Mode , and today weâ€™re looking into a few more places where Nano Banana appears to be getting ready to make an appearance. title: A secret ingredient thatâ€™ll make future smartphones blazing fast is almost ready
summary: UFS 5.0 will make future phones faster without draining more power.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The next generation UFS 5.0 standard is nearly ready and promises much faster speeds compared to UFS 4.0. Itâ€™s designed to make phones faster and more power-efficient, especially for AI-driven tasks. UFS 5.0 is expected to appear in smartphones launching in 2027 and beyond. Smartphones releasing in the next year or so are in line to get a major speed boost. No, weâ€™re not talking about a new processor, but a major upgrade coming to smartphone storage. According to JEDEC , the group that develops the UFS standard, the next-generation Universal Flash Storage, UFS 5.0, is almost ready.

title: Samsungâ€™s next smart calling trick looks straight out of Googleâ€™s Pixel playbook
summary: Automatic call screening is coming with One UI 8.5, and users will be able to select the auto-screening level.
body: Credit: Calvin Wankhede / Android Authority TL;DR Samsungâ€™s upcoming One UI 8.5 update is expected to include a new automatic call screening feature. Previously leaked code suggests that the feature will enable an AI assistant to answer and transcribe calls automatically. New code suggests that users will have multiple control options to customize when automatic call screening is in use, similar to Pixels. One UI 8.5 is destined to be the next big update for Galaxy phones and tablets, and it will be a bigger deal than One UI 8. Leaks suggest that Samsung will reserve most of its newer features and bigger changes for this x.5 release. We have also found out that One UI 8.5 will be based on Android 16 QPR2 , which will also bring all the new QPR features to Samsungâ€™s devices. Weâ€™ve also spotted that automatic call screening is coming to Galaxy phones , and it seems Samsung still has more improvements in the pipeline for this feature. title: Galaxy S23 series owners in the US are finally getting stable One UI 8
summary: Samsung's latest update is now available to S23 series owners in the US.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung is rolling out the One UI 8 update to the Galaxy S23 series in the US. Users have reported that unlocked and carrier models are receiving the new software. The software brings a new lock screen clock, call captions, and more to the Galaxy S23 series. Samsung has gradually brought the One UI 8 update to its older Galaxy phones, and itâ€™s already available on the Galaxy S23 series in some markets. The US apparently wasnâ€™t included in this initial global rollout, but thereâ€™s some good news. Galaxy S23 series owners in the US (h/t: SamMobile ) are now reporting that theyâ€™re getting the One UI 8 update. Users on Reddit and the Samsung Community forum have chimed in to confirm that theyâ€™ve received the new software.

title: Pixel 10 is going viral for struggling with a major Android game (Updated: Google statement)
summary: The game technically doesn't support the Pixel 10's GPU, but is it really that bad?
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR Viral videos show the Pixel 10 Pro XL completely glitching out while running the latest version of Genshin Impact. The problems could be related to the Pixel 10 shipping with a PowerVR GPU, for which the gameâ€™s makers dropped support earlier this year. A future driver update might fix performance issues, but if game developers keep dropping support for PowerVR GPUs, Google may need to rethink its strategy. Google says they have worked with miHoYo over the past year to ensure the game runs smoothly on the Pixel 10 series. Updated: October 7, 2025 (12 AM ET): A Google spokesperson provided the following statement to Android Authority, clarifying that Genshin Impact will continue running on the Pixel 10 series.

title: BLACKPINKâ€™s JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: â€˜Two Voices, OneÂ Orbitâ€™
summary: Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai.
body: BLACKPINK â€™s JISOO has hinted at the release of a surprise duet this month. On Monday (Oct. 6), she unveiled a mysterious teaser image on social media, featuring a shadowed male silhouette standing behind her, with the word â€œEYESCLOSEDâ€ written across the frame â€” suggesting an upcoming collaboration. “A duet is near,” the caption reads. A second post brought the shadowed male closer to the forefront, with the caption: “two voices, one orbit. coming soon.” The mysterious collaborator has been revealed to be Zayn Malik , a former member of One Direction. In the teaser, JISOO stands in the foreground while the male figure looms behind her â€” his back turned, adding intrigue to the release. Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai. After the show, he shared a photo from the audience with the caption: â€œ@BLACKPINKOFFICIAL THANK YOU ğŸ™‚ ME & KHAI LOVED IT,â€ sparking curiosity about the connection between the two artists. The upcoming duet will mark JISOOâ€™s first new music release since her solo EP Amortage  in February, which featured tracks like â€œEarthquake,â€ â€œYour Loveâ€ and â€œHugs & Kâ€¦

title: Google Japanâ€™s latest keyboard fever dream puts a new spin on rotary dialing
summary: Retro tech meets DIY as Google turns an old-school phone dial into a working keyboard.
body: TL;DR Google Japan has a long history of announcing humorous new keyboard ideas. Last year the team brought us an infinitely curving Mobius strip keyboard. This year weâ€™re going back to the days of rotary phones, with a rotary-dial keyboard. Has the Google of 2025 lost some of the spark that made the company seem like such a fun place to work in decades past? Thatâ€™s probably a fair criticism, and while it may have been an inevitability for a tech firm of this size, weâ€™re still just pleased as punch when some of that old, weird Google manages to shine through. Thatâ€™s exactly why weâ€™re as happy as we are to see the crew over at Google Japan so gleefully coming back year after year with a preposterous new keyboard design â€” and this year, they cooked up something just fantastically bizarre. Samsung adds a lot of features to its tablets and foldables that make them more productive, and One UI 8 , which is rolling out to several tablets, including our Galaxy Tab S10 Plus , brings some nice changes to Samsungâ€™s apps that make using them on a large screen more pleasant. title: Verizonâ€™s new promo uses AI to allegedly give you a better deal than T-Mobile or AT&T
summary: Verizon is taking aim at AT&T and T-Mobile customers with a new promo that aims to get you a better deal with Big Red.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Verizon is trying to shed its â€œpremium-priceâ€ image by launching a new promotion aimed directly at AT&T and T-Mobile customers. Itâ€™s new AI-powered â€œBring your billâ€ tool analyzes rival bills and applies comparable pricing and promotional credits to match or beat them. The matched rates are locked for 36 months, but prices will rise afterward, making it a short-term value play rather than a permanent discount. Verizon has a well-earned reputation for solid network performance, but at a much higher price than the competition. Over the last few years, this has changed a bit as T-Mobile has become a major leader in 5G and beyond. The truth is that all three major carriers now offer fairly similar features and performance overall, though it ultimately depends on where you live. What really sets carriers the most is quickly becoming price and value. Thatâ€™s not an area that Big Red usually excels at, but with its newest promotion , itâ€™s promising to get more competitive here than ever before. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I found an Android launcher that combines the best of Niagara and Nova Launcher
summary: Everyone, meet Mur Launcher.
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority About 15 years ago, when I first switched from a Nokia to an Android phone, it wasnâ€™t a mere choice; it was also a financial decision. I couldnâ€™t afford to buy an iPhone, and its price, padded with hefty import fees, made it a dream I refused to approach. Over the years, I became more fascinated with Androidâ€™s customization. A decade and a half later, I consciously stick to Android phones. While my attempts at heavily modding my phones or fiddling with custom ROMs have decreased significantly, there are two things I still actively do: change wallpapers routinely and switch to a new launcher every few weeks or months, actively hopping between multiple awesome launchers on Android .

title: 5 journaling apps you should use instead of Pixel Journal
summary: Googleâ€™s journal app might be a Pixel-exclusive, but that doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s the best out there.
body: Google rolled out a set of exclusive apps for the Pixel 10 smartphone line, including a new personal reflection app called Pixel Journal . Iâ€™ve already covered it in a separate article, but to summarize, itâ€™s an AI-enhanced diary app that offers contextual writing prompts, support for attached images and maps, and is designed using Googleâ€™s new Material 3 Expressive design language. Naturally, it seems like a perfect fit for Pixel users. However, Google didnâ€™t invent the diary app. In fact, plenty of other journal apps have existed on the platform for years, each offering something a little different. If you arenâ€™t impressed by Pixel Journalâ€™s AI features, find it overwhelming, or donâ€™t think it delves deep enough, here are some apps you should consider instead.

title: OpenAIâ€™s always-on AI device is plagued by various issues
summary: From privacy concerns to cloud computing power, OpenAI's upcoming AI device is facing a few teething issues.
body: Credit: OpenAI TL;DR A new report has revealed specific development issues facing OpenAI and Jony Iveâ€™s new AI device. Major issues include the assistantâ€™s personality and voice, privacy issues, and cloud computing power. Another source corroborated a previous claim that this device would be always-on rather than requiring a wake word. OpenAI and former Apple designer Jony Ive announced work on a mysterious new AI device last year, and weâ€™ve heard a few details since then. Now, a new report has revealed specific issues with this upcoming device. The Financial Times (FT) reports that OpenAI has encountered a variety of obstacles as it develops the new AI gadget. Furthermore, the outletâ€™s sources say these issues could delay the deviceâ€™s release. However, one source said these problems were typical of the product development process.

title: I tested ChatGPTâ€™s new Sora 2 model against Googleâ€™s Veo 3, and the difference is astounding
summary: Google had a mammoth lead in AI video generation, but OpenAI has upended that status quo.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority If you buy a Pixel 10 Pro series phone, or even last yearâ€™s Pixel 9 Pro, you get one full yearâ€™s worth of Googleâ€™s Gemini Pro subscription. This $20-per-month service unlocks the powerful Gemini 2.5 Pro model and a suite of cutting-edge AI tools. Until very recently, the crown jewel of this package was Veo 3, Googleâ€™s impressive text-to-video generator that could turn any description into a hyper-realistic short video. But the AI world moves at lightning speed. This past week, OpenAI announced its competing Sora 2 model, meaning Googleâ€™s video generator is no longer the only game in town. While Sora 2 is invite-only for now, the model already has an active user base. So naturally, I took OpenAIâ€™s Sora 2 for a spin vs Googleâ€™s Veo 3 to find out which AI video generator has the upper hand.

title: These 5 apps help me hit my financial goals, stress free
summary: Some of these I have to pay for, but they are well worth the cost.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Iâ€™m very organized when it comes to everything money-related. I always save a certain percentage of my income for a rainy day, invest regularly for the future, and try to stay on top of all the latest news on the financial markets to spot short-term opportunities. However, the road to achieving my financial goals is long and unpredictable, so I take any help I can get. I regularly rely on five apps that help me on my journey and have proven to be invaluable. Hereâ€™s why. YNAB

title: The Pixel 10 Proâ€™s 100x zoom is way too good, with one caveat
summary: Great looking photo you took there, but is it real?
body: What is a photo? I see that question on my timeline more and more, and as phone makers begin to introduce AI-enhanced photos, the question is valid. When Google announced 100x Pro Res Zoom on its new Pixel 10 Pro lineup â€” which uses AI to enhance a very digitally-zoomed-in photo â€” that question of what makes a photo a photo rang loudly in my mind. Does it really matter how the photo is created if you like the end result and it looks like what itâ€™s supposed to look like? Well, that depends, and weâ€™ll get to that, but first letâ€™s dive in and take a look at what this 100x zoom looks like in real-life use. As far as the eye can seeâ€¦and then some I was shocked the first time I scrolled all the way to the right on the zoom slider, snapped my photo, then watched the sparkles dance around on my screen as Googleâ€™s artificial intelligence worked to recreate and enhance what I only saw as a grainy, pixelated scene on my screen. Within a few moments, the dancing pixels dissolved to reveal the final result: an incredibly detailed and very accurate photograph of a scene that I could hardly see with my own eyes. Consider me mind-blown. That moment truly felt shocking.

title: Androidâ€™s new Computer Control feature shows the Rabbit R1 was ahead of its time
summary: Google is working on a Computer Control feature that will let you automate Android apps. Here's how.
body: For a brief period last year, it seemed that AI-powered gadgets like the Rabbit R1 were going to be the next big thing. People were fascinated by the idea of replacing their smartphones with tiny wearable boxes they could talk to, but unfortunately, these gadgets failed to live up to the hype. They failed for a variety of reasons â€” like price, redundancy, and utility â€” but the seeds they planted for a future of fully automated apps stuck around. These seeds grew into the â€œagentic AIâ€ trend we see today. Companies are racing to build AI products that can perform tasks on your behalf, like helping you code a new project, booking an appointment, or ordering items online. As one of the leaders in the AI race, Google is also working on its own AI agents, with Gemini in Chrome being its most notable offering.

title: I canâ€™t believe everyone loves NotebookLM this much when it lacks such a crucial feature
summary: NotebookLM skips over graphs, drawings, and flowcharts â€” the exact context I often need.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority For the past few months, itâ€™s been NotebookLM this and NotebookLM that . Googleâ€™s AI tool has captured the interest of anyone who deals with numerous large documents and files, becoming essential for thousands of students, lawyers, marketers, and more. We even use it here on Android Authority to make some of our internal guides interactive. Just ask a question and get the answer straight from the documentation. NotebookLM is fantastic for that. Itâ€™s a powerful search tool, study buddy, and assistant in one. Plus, it doesnâ€™t hallucinate like other AI tools trained on quasi-infinite data; it just uses the sources you give it, so you know youâ€™ll be getting a proper answer. My problem with it is that it hides the source away when itâ€™s a PDF file, and that really limits its usefulness for anything other than text.

title: My favorite Spotify feature makes other music apps completely useless in the car
summary: Spotify Jam is the Android Auto feature my road trips needed the most.
body: There are many reasons why I still choose Spotify over other music streaming services , and Iâ€™m aware that some readers think Iâ€™m crazy â€” but hear me out. Iâ€™ve already mentioned why Spotify Duo is perfect for my household, and then thereâ€™s Spotify Connect, which lets me control music on my PS4 and other devices through my phone. Iâ€™ve also grown accustomed to the playlists it generates for me, many of which reliably contain great tracks. However, perhaps the biggest reason I stick with Spotify is its collaborative queue editing feature, Spotify Jam. Our household often listens to music selected spontaneously rather than from a set playlist. So, when my partner wants to add a track to my queue or me to hers, we can join a Jam and start rearranging and adding tracks as we please. Naturally, this feature is a household favorite and a strong reason we rely on Spotify, and recently, the feature got even better.

title: The real reasons more people donâ€™t switch to prepaid service over the big three carriers
summary: Concerns about performance, phone selection, and confusion over an abudance of options are just a few common reasons.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority Itâ€™s 2025, and more people are finally getting on board with prepaid, largely because of ever-increasing prices and broken promises from the Big Three carriers. Still, Iâ€™m sure we all know a few holdouts, or you might be one yourself. A little over a year ago, I argued that prepaid was a better option for many people, and that reluctance to switch was driven by persistent myths . Many of those points still hold, but awareness has improved, and so has prepaid market penetration. When you remove some of the most common myths from the equation, what are the real reasons people still donâ€™t switch to prepaid? I dug into the most common ones I hear from friends, family, and online communities. Here are the biggest reasons some people say prepaid isnâ€™t worth the switch. We also look a bit deeper at how valid these reasons are in reality.

A recent teardown found that the Pixel 10 may be the most repairable phone of the year. If youâ€™re a DIY kind of person and plan to repair your Pixel 10 device on your own, then youâ€™re going to need the right parts. You wonâ€™t have to look hard, as iFixit now offers genuine Pixel 10 parts. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: NASA, Blue Origin Invite Media to Attend Mars Mission Launch
summary: NASA and Blue Origin are reopening media accreditation for the launch of the agencyâ€™s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers) mission. The twin ESCAPADE spacecraft will study the solar windâ€™s interaction with Mars, providing insight into the planetâ€™s real-time response to sâ€¦
body: A stylized illustration shows the twin ESCAPADE spacecraft entering Marsâ€™ orbit. Credits: James Rattray/Rocket Lab USA NASA and Blue Origin are reopening media accreditation for the launch of the agencyâ€™s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers) mission. The twin ESCAPADE spacecraft will study the solar windâ€™s interaction with Mars, providing insight into the planetâ€™s real-time response to space weather and how solar activity drives atmospheric escape. This will be the second launch of Blue Originâ€™s New Glenn rocket. Media interested in covering ESCAPADE launch activities must apply for media credentials. Media who previously applied for media credentials for the ESCAPADE launch do not need to reapply. U.S. media and U.S. citizens representing international media must apply by 11:59 p.m. EDT on Monday, Oct. 13. Media accreditation requests should be submitted online to: https://media.ksc.nasa.gov . A copy of NASAâ€™s media accreditation policy is available online. For questions about accreditation, please email: ksc-media-accreditat@mail.nasa.gov . title: Jupiterâ€™s Volcanic Moon Io
summary: During its close flyby of Jupiterâ€™s moon Io on December 30, 2023, NASAâ€™s Juno spacecraft captured some of the most detailed imagery ever of Ioâ€™s volcanic surface. In this image, taken by the JunoCam instrument from about 930 miles (1,500 kilometers) above the moon, Ioâ€™s night side [left lobe] is ilâ€¦
body: NASA/Jet Propulsion Laboratoryâ€“Caltech/Southwest Research Institute (SwRI)/Malin Space Science Systems (MSSS); Image processing: Emma WÃ¤limÃ¤ki Â© CC BY During its close flyby of Jupiterâ€™s moon Io on December 30, 2023, NASAâ€™s Juno spacecraft captured some of the most detailed imagery ever of Ioâ€™s volcanic surface. In this image, taken by the JunoCam instrument from about 930 miles (1,500 kilometers) above the moon, Ioâ€™s night side [left lobe] is illuminated by â€œJupitershine,â€ which is sunlight reflected from the planetâ€™s surface. This image is the NASA Science Image of the Month for October 2025 . Each month, NASAâ€™s Science Mission Directorate chooses an image to feature, offering desktop wallpaper downloads, as well as links to related topics, activities, and games.
